instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
this macbook came in alive, but cursor is staggering, and macbook is slow, fan maximum, 
i run asd 3s155 os version, and see that TA0P ambient air sensor is failed
smc have greenish thing near it, and i already reballed smc but still the same, i can't seem to locate ambient air sensor location..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message: trackpad and the cable surely good..,other board works flawlessly on that cable and trackpad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
Inspect trackpad connector.
Test the board disconnecting webcam and airport.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
trackpad connector looks good
the backside of trackpad connector near <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> has a bit of greenish thing.. but im not sure where's the wrong unless i measure something.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
disconnecting webcam airport still same
<CHIP>U4850</CHIP> doesnt look too good, but does it matter ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message: TA0P should be <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>. Only failing sensor? (make sure to select continue on error in ASD)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
Inspect <CHIP>U5510</CHIP> area for corrosion.
Check continuity to its sensors, <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>/15/20.
Be sure parallel caps are not corroded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
yeah ta0p is the only failing sensor, and some memory test too
i have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR>, but still the same..
board is relatively clean off corrosion..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message: Did you check continuity as instructed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
yeah continuity is good, all sensor is connected to each other and to <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>'s caps too.
heat pch but still the same, time to let it go then..
thanks for the guidance piernov and 2informaticos!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message:
I've got similar problem on 2936 board.
In that case, two series resistors are placed on PCH SMLink 1 (<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR>/23).
I solved the problem removing these resistors.

For 3115, PCH SMLink1 is directly connected to PCH.
Try to cutoff these lines, close to PCH.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> slow, asd error TA0P
threads.message: I had same issue with a 3115 except all three thermal sensors were intermittently flagging errors in ASD and fans were running high. Reheat of <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> and reball of SMC fixed the issue. In my case all 3 sensors had good continuity to connections on the board and were reading similar voltages/pulses.
